title: Do You Have A Plan B For Your Mnemonics And Memory Techniques?
description:
In case you've ever found yourself in a situation where you needed to make a Memory Palace or use memory techniques on the fly ... you might have been caught off guard. 

But it doesn't have to be that way if you've got A Plan B for your mnemonics. This video shows you how. For follow-up info, check out these Episodes of the Magnetic Memory Method Podcast:

Jonathan Levi On ADD, Education And His TEDTalk Memory Palace

http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/jonathan-levi/

Jonathan's TEDTalk: "What If Schools Taught Us To Learn?"

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vtQzuwnyW6E

Extreme Memory Improvement: How Nelson Dellis Pushes The Limits Of Recall For The Good Of Humanity

http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/extreme-memory-improvement-nelson-dellis/

Nelson's TEDTalk:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ESGEW_uK1Jg

Enjoy and let me know if you have questions! 

Sincerely, 

Anthony Metivier

title: Visual And Creative Thinking For Mnemonics
description:
There are a couple of podcasts on the Magnetic Memory Method website that I think will help you with visual and creative thinking for mnemonics. The first has to do with using childhood experiences:

http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/3-memory-games-you-can-play-with-your-childhood/

Then there is this general creativity boosting podcast episode:

http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/7-ways-to-make-your-memory-swiss-army-knife-sharp/

This one will help too:

http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/brain-training/

Anyhow, when you're using a Memory Palace, any memory technique or mnemonics of any kind, creative thinking is key and I hope these resources help. 

Sincerely, 

Anthony

title: The Memory Palace Of Matteo Ricci
description:
This is pretty much a book report on The Memory Palace of Matteo Ricci: http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/the-memory-palace-of-matteo-ricci/

I think you'll like it because in addition to all the stuff about memory techniques and info about using a Memory Palace (actually, it's kind of limited on that front), the book is just downright entertaining. 

Plus, I've extracted some interesting material from it that will help you use mnemonics better. 

At least ... That's my hope. 

If you're interested in more, I'd be pleased if you listened to the episode of the Magnetic Memory Method Podcast and of course you're welcome to leave your comments and/or questions. 

Talk soon!

Sincerely, 

Anthony

title: Magnetic Memory Method Memory Improvement Kit Tutorial Video
description:
Get the Magnetic Memory Method FREE Memory Improvement Kit here: http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/free-memory-improvement-kit/

This Memory Palace tool kit will help you use the Method of Loci quickly. If you're interested in the Mind Palace technique or always wanted to create a Memory Palace so you can use the journey method, you're in for a real treat. 

The memory techniques Anthony has for you will take your skills to the next level - fast!

And if you're just a beginner with mnemonics like the Memory Palace, no problem. These are the foundations many thousands have wished they had many years ago.

title: Memory Improvement Book Unboxing Memory And Intellectual Improvement
description:
Get your FREE Memory Improvement Kit here: http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/free-memory-improvement-kit/

So I'm unboxing Memory And Intellectual Improvement Applied To Self-Education And Juvenile Instruction by Orson Squire Fowler. It looks like it's going to be a good book, even if there's nothing squarely discussed about using a Memory Palace or memory techniques or mnemonics as such. 

It would be funny if time machines existed, however. Then I could sneak a reference to the Magnetic Memory Method into it ... 

Anyhow, I couldn't find this particular book by Fowler on Project Gutenberg, but there's a photo and some info about him on the site along with what appears to be his main textbook on phrenology:

http://www.self.gutenberg.org/articles/Orson_Squire_Fowler

Wacky stuff to be sure ...

What about you? What books have you read from the past about memory techniques and the like? 

Talk soon!

Sincerely, 

Anthony Metivier

title: How To Win The USA Memory Championship
description:
http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/nelson/

Listen in as Nelson Dellis teaches you how to win the USA Memory Championship. His abilities with mnemonics and memory techniques in general is extraordinary. 

And the best part is that he also puts his skills towards charitable causes. You can get involved any time you like by taking his extreme memory challenge here (it doesn't cost a dime):

http://www.extremememorychallenge.com/

title: Memory Technique And Memory Palace Creativity Warm Up Secrets
description:
http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/free-memory-improvement-kit/

A lot of people take up a new memory technique or start to use a Memory Palace with great excitement. 

But for some reason, the memory improvement they seek just isn't happening. 

There's a reason for this: It's because they haven't warmed themselves up.

So in this video, I teach you two critical warmup techniques that you can use each and every time you memorize so that you get way more success. 

Enjoy! 

Sincerely, 

Anthony

title: Memorize A Shuffled Deck Of Cards Challenge Video 3
description:
Want to learn more about the techniques talked about in this video? Grab this FREE Memory Improvement Kit: http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/free-memory-improvement-kit/

In this third video in my memorize a shuffled deck of cards series, I used an impromptu Memory Palace based on chairs just outside the cafe window. Normally I would not do this, but it had an interesting effect. 

I also used columns instead of linear lines of action and clumped the cards into groups of three or four. It works really well and sped up the process. 

If you're learning to use memory techniques, I highly suggest you explore this column approach in either an established Memory Palace or one you build on the fly. It works great. 

Talk soon! :)

Sincerely, 

Anthony Metivier

title: Memorize A Shuffled Deck Of Cards Challenge Video 2
description:
I have a Free Memory Improvement Kit for your here: http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/free-memory-improvement-kit/

You might not want to memorize a shuffled deck of cards, but trust me, it's good mental exercise. 

Even if you're not using the Magnetic Memory Method to do it, there's a ton of other ways to use mnemonics, a Memory Palace and other memory techniques to make your mind and memory super strong. 

And as Harry Lorayne once said, even just thinking about memory techniques has a special effect. So I invite you to follow along with this challenge and see what you can learn about the nature of memory.

title: Memorize A Shuffled Deck Of Cards Challenge Video 1
description:
http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/free-memory-improvement-kit/

Have you ever wanted to memorize a shuffled deck of cards? If so, follow along with this challenge. You need only a basic understanding of mnemonics, how to use a Memory Palace and other simple to understand aspects of memory techniques. 

Memorization of cards is a huge part of the World Memory Championships, but you can use the practice to get better at memory in general. It's a fantastic way to develop speed with using a Memory Palace and will make you more creative in many ways. 

And as I talk about in this video, you can add obstructions that will create greater focus and other kinds of inspiration. 

Special thanks to Nelson Dellis for giving me the inspiration for the challenge - you rock!

title: The Ugly Sister Effect And Memory Techniques
description:
Get more from mnemonics by overcoming the Ugly Sister Effect: http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/beginners-guide-to-overcoming-the-ugly-sister-effect/

If you've ever had problems with "ghosting" or what is sometimes called "the ugly sister effect" when using mnemonics, here's a way to stop these things from getting between you and amazing results from memory techniques. 

Although it is primarily a bother for people who use a Memory Palace, it also applies to linking and the keyword memory technique. 

But it doesn't have to be a problem for you. This video and the podcast version on Magnetic Memory Method podcast will help you learn more and overcome the problem. Check it out! :)

title: Magnetic Memory Method Live in London Testimonial From Gareth Popkins
description:

title: Giordano Bruno Statue In Rome
description:
http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/bruno/

Scott Gosnell, the translator of two books by the mnemonist Giordano Bruno talks about the man, his writings and the application of his memory techniques to everyday life.

You‚Äôll also learn:

* How to use Star Wars (or any movie you‚Äôre familiar with) as a Memory Palace.

* Why Scott‚Äôs translations of Giordano Bruno are the product of perhaps the best form of procrastination you‚Äôll ever hear about (and maybe even be inspired to do some similar procrastination of your own for the good of humanity).

* Scott‚Äôs amazing Memory Palace technique for students, possibly the most amazing technique you could add to your studies that I‚Äôve ever heard!

* Bruno‚Äôs idea that an intelligible system exists behind the world and how this connects to memory.

* How to use memorized objects as Memory Palace locations.

* How studying Bruno‚Äôs systems could help you coordinate your knowledge while learning to retain it.

* Why Francis Yates‚Äô interpretation of Bruno‚Äôs activities in The Art Of Memory and Giordano Bruno and the Hermetic Tradition may not be the best way to think about his memory improvement projects.

*  Why Bruno was really interested in the psychology and neuroscience of the human mind ‚Äì not magic.

* Why Bruno thought his memory system could give you an internal representation of the entire universe ‚Ä¶ or did he?

* Why Bruno felt it was a practical concern to keep your Memory Palace well lit and not place your associative-imagery on a background of the same color.

* How context sensitive cues can either help or harm your memory.

* Why Bruno likens Memory Palaces to writing so that you can scan a Memory Palace for memorized information the way you would scan a page looking for a particular word.

* Why Bruno‚Äôs execution probably had nothing ‚Äì or at least very little ‚Äì to do with his mnemonic systems.

* Thoughts on Bruno as a ‚Äúmarketer‚Äù of memory techniques.

* Why memory techniques were a very useful talent for a king to have (and still are even if you‚Äôre not a king).

* Why Bruno most likely wasn‚Äôt a spy ‚Äì but probably would have made a good one had he been.

* Why Bruno thought that the Memory Palace was the best and most effective memory method available, even though he also used smaller methods like linking, lists and poetry.

*  ‚Ä¶ and much, much more.

title: How To Improve Your Memory Using Strategically Organized Memory Palaces
description:
How to Improve your Memory? Us this FREE Memory Improvement Kit: http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/free-memory-improvement-kit/

As you know, I love to answer questions about how to use a Memory Palace and memory techniques to finally get results. 

In this video, I answer a very specific question. It goes like this:

I'm a med student in Minnesota that is a big believer in memory palace/loci techniques.  Before finding you on the internet I followed a couple of other folks, but I like how your system really helps to scaffold a persons memory skills from where they are to where they want to get.  But I'm in trouble and need your help.

I haven‚Äôt been doing too hot on my exams lately and I'm in serious need of some guidance.  Basically, I want go be able to use this system to catalog and remember my lectures.  Since I have a lot of lectures (usually about 1 hour in length and  between 20-50 per course @ 4 courses per semester) I figured that it would be helpful to systematized the places and rules I use for my memory palaces.  So far my rules work well but the places I'm having trouble with.  I've been using Google maps to learn new neighborhoods in my city. 

What I would like to do is to take a city block with 10 houses and use those 10 houses as palaces for 10 lectures.  I'd like to maximize the amount of info that can be stored on each house by placing 6 pair (12 total) of analog clocks in consistent locations around the front of the house (Google only provides views of the house from the street or above).  Then the hatch marks on the clocks can be micro loci for more information.

The problem is that I think its too cluttered and it's taking too much effort to see and remember images.  I know the  images are 'sticky' enough because when I take the same scenes  and place them in a more spread  out palace, they work great.  Also, I think part of  the  problem is because I‚Äôm looking at the image as a picture and tracing the picture with  my eyes instead of being in the picture and walking along in it.  However, because I'm using the front of a house from street view there's really not a whole bunch of walking available to me.

What I need are ideas on how to systematized large amounts of data that also allow me loci for the  requisite detail I need.  What I want to avoid is having a bunch of unrelated memory palaces for lectures in the same subject.

Thanks for your help!

Happy to help. Please get busy using the Method of Loci in your Memory Palace now that you know how to improve your memory strategically.

title: How To Enhance Your Memory With Virtual Memory Palaces
description:
Want to know how to enhance your memory? Here's a detailed description of the right way to do it using a virtual Memory Palace: http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/how-to-enhance-your-memory-with-virtual-memory-palaces/

Have you felt stressed out lately?

I‚Äôll bet you have.

Me too.

Stress sucks, and worse than being a drag, it‚Äôs a memory killer too.

But not always.

On occasion, stress can make certain things memorable. Car accidents, terrorist attacks and riots can make many things impossible to forget. Such events can can even lead to post-traumatic stress disorder.

Usually, though, stress punishes our bodies and minds without the need of catastrophe. Work, relationship problems and health can all create stress.

Stress gets in the way of goals and dreams. Important professional missions like:

Studying for exams and professional certifications.
Learning a language.
Remembering the names of the important people you meet.
But stress distracts from these activities. Stress makes paying attention difficult and learning new information becomes almost impossible.

If anything, all you learn is how to be more stressed out.

But when you use memory techniques and mnemonics, a lot of great things can happen that will reduce stress and let you experience memory improvement.

description:
http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/free-memory-improvement-kit/

Wondering how to increase memory instead of wasting time on spaced repetition, rote learning and boring memory skills? Consider using a car as a Memory Palace. This method of combining the Method of Loci with your car is the ultimate memory technique, especially for memorizing a deck of cards or other limited set amounts of information you may be using for memory improvement. 

Give it a try and let me know your questions. :)

title: Memory Tips From Aristotle Part Four
description:
https://www.udemy.com/memory-tips-and-aristotle-on-memory/?couponCode=yt

In this fourth video of Memory Tips from Aristotle, we start getting into the real meat of the matter by talking about Aristotle's response to Plato's writings on memory. 

It's a different way of teaching you to understand how to use a memory technique by thinking about the philosophical history of memory. So although there's no direct help in overcoming spaced repetition and rote learning or using a Memory Palace or mnemonics, you're going to hear from one of the first guys to use "mnemonic" in writing and how he talked about memory improvement. Pretty cool, right? :)

title: Photographic Memory Is A Scam
description:
http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/free-memory-improvement-kit/

Here's the url for this episode of the Magnetic Memory Method Podcast:
http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/photographic-memory/

If you're interested in improving your memory in ways that don't rely upon fallacies and pseudoscience, then you're going to want to stay away from photographic memory scams. People who deal with memory skills and mnemonics and the entire world of memory improvement work every day to bring you trusted techniques that actually work. I'm talking about the Method of Loci, the Memory Palace and all manner of memory improvement strategies that you need to succeed. Don't fall for the looney notion of photographic memory because it just isn't real.

title: Luca Lampariello On How To Master Any Language
description:
http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/luca-lampariello-on-how-to-master-any-language/

In this video, I talk about Luca Lampariello's language learning technique. We also touch upon memory skills and language study as an art that goes far beyond the spaced repetition and rote learning advice you usually hear. Although we don't talk much about memory improvement, the use of a Memory Palace or anything even closely related to the Method of Loci, the interview doesn't go by without at least a subtle sense of at least one memory technique at work. 

It was a lot of fun interviewing Luca live and in person, but if you want to hear more, please be sure to check out our previous two interviews:

http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/mmmp-05-luca-lampariello-talks-about-language-as-a-net/

http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/luca-lampariello-on-working-memory-and-the-oceans-of-language/

You can also use the link at the very top of this description to visit the Magnetic Memory Method site and download the MP3 and MP4 of the interview if you wish. Enjoy and share with anyone you know who is learning a language!

description:
http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/free-memory-improvement-kit/

In this video, I show you a mnemonic strategy using your smart phone, a digital dictionary and a Memory Palace to memorize lots and lots of Spanish vocabulary. Mnemonics truly are the best way to succeed with language learning. Language learning without index cards or spaced repetition software is without a doubt the best way to gain energy from your language learning efforts rather than lose it through frustration and a lack of results. Enjoy this video and please be in touch if you have any questions whatsoever. 

In the meantime, realize this: You can learn Spanish vocabulary faster. And you can do so in a way that is fun, inspiring and gets massive results in a short period of time. Just give the procedures discussed in this video a try and you'll see. 

Talk soon!

Anthony Metivier

title: Bach From Memory
description:
http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/free-memory-improvement-kit/

This is Courante of Suite #2 in D Minor. The link above will give you a lesson in how to quickly memorize it.

A lot of people ask me about memorizing Bach. I haven't written a book about it yet, but it will be focused on memorizing music for bass. 

Why? Because it has four strings and that's what I play the most. In other words, I only use my system on bass. 

By the way, it may look to you like I'm reading, but that's just because I "forgot" to look away instead of staring into space. LOL. 

Anyhow, to memorize Bach quickly, I use a memory technique grounded in the Memory Palace method I teach over at magneticmemorymethod.com. You can find some posts over there about memorizing music that will give you some insight into what's going on until I can get around to writing the book. :)

title: How To Remember Hiragana Fast So You Can Learn Japanese Easier [Hiragana Mnemonic Examples]
description:
Get my FREE Memory Improvement Kit here: http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/free-memory-improvement-kit/

Using the Method of Loci for hiragana when you start to learn Japanese is okay, but...

There's something better to help you learn hiragana. It's called the Magnetic Memory Method. 

The technique doesn't 100% leave spaced repetition behind, but through the magic of mnemonics, it's one of the easy ways to remember hiragana that you'll never forget. 

Best part? 

You can apply this same technique to katakana and kanji and even entire Japanese phrases. 

And if you're looking for a learn Japanese app, the Memory Palace is going to do you so much good. Just look at what Kevin Richardson has achieved (including sketches of his Memory Palace for Japanese notebooks):

https://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/learn-japanese-app/

Since interviewing Kevin about his success using mnemonics for the hiragana, I've interviewed another student name Sunil Khatri. He's now a Japanse Memory Palace master! Listen in here:

https://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/japanese-memory-palace-mastery/

If you're tired of rote learning and spaced repetition, then the alternative to using this "time honored" but dull and deadly techniques make this the most important free video training you'll ever see. In this 18-minute presentation you'll learn exactly how to build a Memory Palace and use it to memorize the Hiragana in 1.5 hours in less. Even better, you'll be able to re-use it for the Katakana and have a solid understanding of its application to the Kanji.

description:
http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/free-memory-improvement-kit/

Hey Memorizer, 

I've got a new project going on that I could use your input on. In order to continually combat the evils of rote learning, I'm working on helping people memorize the Japanese Hiragana with ease. 

Yes, that's right. With ease. 

Many people say that to learn Japanese is impossible, but I say that it's all about two things: 

1) Mindset

In this episode of the Magnetic Memory Method, we have a special interview with Phil Chambers. Phil is a World Mind Mapping Champion who works closely with the World Memory Championships as a scorer and statistician who does not believe that memory competitors have even come close to reaching their limits.

As a memory skills trainer, Phil is also the founder and managing director of Learning Technologies and author of Brilliant Speed Reading. Amongst other co-authored books, he has written with James Smith How to Remember Equations and Formulae.

title: How to Memorize the Vocabulary of Any Language Using A Memory Palace
description:
Would you like to know how to learn 200 Words (Or More!) in ANY language ... In as little as only 10 days? 

If you need this video in written form, check out this post on how to memorize vocabulary:

https://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/how-to-memorize-vocabulary/

In this video: 

How to Learn & Memorize the Vocabulary of Any Language ... Using the Magnetic Memory Method (Advanced Memory Palaces)

If you'd like to improve your ability to learn and memorize foreign language vocabulary by as much as 100%, 200%, even 300% ... using simple memory techniques that you can learn in a few short hours (or less), then this may be the most important video course you will ever view.

Believe it or not, it doesn't matter if you have a good memory or not.

The information in this course will teach you:

‚Ä¢Why memory is like a bicycle everyone can ride (with some minor personal adjustments).

‚Ä¢The real reason why no one should ever be squeamish about memorization or learning a language.

‚Ä¢Why and how some of the most famous memory skills are applicable to language learning.

‚Ä¢How to create a 26 "letter location" memory palace network based on the English alphabet.

‚Ä¢Unique techniques that will have you literally "tuning in" on your dream foreign language.

‚Ä¢How to separate foreign language words in the most effective manner for memorization.

‚Ä¢ A simple strategy for memorizing the male, neuter and feminine genders (depending on the language, this is a process that some people consider the ultimate nightmare of language learning.)

‚Ä¢Two secret ways to use relaxation to aid the memorization process. These two methods alone are worth the price of this course because they will literally eliminate stress from your body as you work on learning and memorizing foreign language vocabulary.

‚Ä¢And much, much more ...

These techniques have been used by real language learners, most of whom previously considered themselves owners of a "bad memory" to make real strides in their foreign language learning efforts.

Don't worry! None of these techniques are rocket science.

Frankly, if you can memorize a short email address or the name of a movie, then you can use this system to memorize the vocabulary of any language.

title: Book Giveaway: The Ultimate Language Learning Secret
description:
http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/free-memory-improvement-kit/

ABOUT THE ULTIMATE LANGUAGE LEARNING SECRET

If you've ever wanted to experience a massive boost in your language learning efforts and see an improvement of 100% ... 200% ... 300% (or more) sooner than you ever imagined possible, then this book may be the most important language learning book you'll ever read.

In "The Ultimate Language Learning Secret," you'll discover:

* How to escape from the prison of your mother tongue so that you can enjoy the benefits of fluency, including better understanding, communication and advanced experiences in travel for pleasure, business and personal development.

* How to identify language learning heroes who can literally transform your current lack of words into an abundance of fluency.

* The magic formula for developing discipline, ability and self-control all at the same time so that you can sit and accomplish your language learning goals quickly, easily and in ways that are effective, easy and fun. (This formula alone is worth double the price of this book.)

* Exactly how to earn and spend the "currency" of fluency so that you can exchange new ideas with the speakers of your target language, earn their admiration and enjoy their respect.

* How to completely re-wire your mind so that the "work" of language learning becomes playtime - every time.

* A precise method for using travel magazines to boost your fluency (and whet your appetite for travel so that you get your butt in the plane and enjoy the amazing benefits of traveling in and through the language you're learning to speak.)

* How to research the absolutely best training materials so that you can always instantly choose the best and invest your time and money wisely.

* How to eliminate negative labels about language learning that most people hold so that you're no longer held back by the nasty "earworms" responsible for "language learning depression."

* Why you need a monolingual dictionary in order to truly succeed at language learning and feel like you're really learning the language like a pro.

* The ultimate no-nonsense time management strategies for language learning that no one has ever taught you before.

* How to train your family, friends and loved ones to give you the necessary space for language learning without having to worry about feeling selfish, needy or coming off as a language learning diva.

* ... and much, much more.

title: Memory Improvement Master Plan Free Resource
description:
http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/free-memory-improvement-kit/

In this free Memory Improvement Master Plan resource, you'll learn: 

* The important connection between space in your Memory Palaces and where you use your Memory Palaces. 

* The amazing value of having a solid routine so that you can see the compound effect of the work you're putting into your memory (developing your memory is more like play than "work", so don't let that nasty word put you off!)

* Why you need to start simple each and every time you memorize something so that you can sail into the more complicated matters with ease (this one tip alone is worth at least a million Magnetic dollars). 

* How to leverage the power of mistakes and turn them into the most powerful memorizing experiences you could ever wish for. 

* When to ditch parts of your Memory Palace so that you can memorize even more material and not get stuck in a ditch. 

* The most important rule in the world for getting past the whining and crying of frustration so that you are always calm and relaxed when working on memorizing material. 

* The productivity secrets of specialization and why you need one. 

* How to train your brain using rewards (I used to think this was corny too until I finally gave it a try ... it works!)

* ... and a whole lot more!

Listen to this episode of the Magnetic Memory Method Podcast and be amazed by what you can achieve using the natural abilities of your mind.

title: Memorize Poetry? Why?
description:
http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/free-memory-improvement-kit/

If you've ever desperately wanted to memorize poetry but absolutely hate the slings and arrows, the sound and the fury of repeating the same lines hundreds of times until they've become more annoying than beautiful ... then this may be the most important book you will ever read.

Believe it or not, it doesn't matter if you have a good memory or not.

In addition to improving your ability to memorize poetry by 100%, 200%, 300% (or more) ... using simple techniques that you can learn in 30 minutes (or less) ... the information in this book will teach you:

‚Ä¢ Why memory is like a bicycle everyone can ride (with some minor personal adjustments).

‚Ä¢ The real reason why no one should ever be squeamish about memorizing poetry.

‚Ä¢ Why and how some of the most famous memory skills are applicable to memorizing poetry.

‚Ä¢ Effortless methods used by the experts to create easy, effective and elegant Memory Palaces for storing poetry (and "stealth" methods that show you how to use them to recall poems right away no matter how long ago you remembered them).

‚Ä¢ Unique techniques that will have you literally "tuning in" on the poetry you read.

‚Ä¢ Exactly how often to recall poetry (a routine that lets people who are brand spanking new to memory techniques to memorize verse quickly and rapidly advance to mastery).

‚Ä¢ A simple strategy for turning boring places you've been into amazing Memory Palaces (learn this technique and you will be able to spin any place you visit from now on into Memory Palace gold).

‚Ä¢ Two secret ways to use relaxation to aid the memorization process. These two methods alone are worth the price of this book because they will literally eliminate stress from your body as you memorize poetry.

‚Ä¢ And much, much more ...

These techniques have been used by poetry fans, most of whom previously considered themselves owners of a "bad memory" to make real strides in memorizing their favorite poems.

Don't worry! None of these techniques involve rocket engineering.

Frankly, if you can memorize a short email address or the name of a movie, then you can use this system to memorize poems as short as a sonnet or as long as an epic.

But there's really no time to lose.

Every day that you are not using this simple memorization method, you are literally stealing from yourself the joy of reading, reciting and intimately knowing world class poetry as you easily expand the natural abilities of your mind.

title: A Memory Palace in Fiction?
description:
http://www.amazon.com/Lucas-Parks-Download-Anthony-Metivier-ebook/dp/B00JD0H34Y

Lucas Parks and the Download of Doom | The Baud Chronicles: Book One

DON'T LET THE BAUD INFECTION SPREAD!

File-sharing thief and gas station employee Lucas Parks is more than he seems. As a young man making money to help care for his couch potato parents while illegally downloading movies every night at the gas station, he unexpectedly learns that he is the progeny of the mysterious time-traveler, Doctor Zoo.

DON'T LET THE BAUD INFECTION SPREAD!

But Lucas doesn't have time to dwell on the news of his true family history. After barely rescuing Lucas from a Viral Download Attack, the notorious Baud Hunter Cowboy Dan whisks him away to help him heal from a growing Baud infection. Caught up in a daring adventure, Lucas discovers that he has extraordinary mental powers far in advance of any other child of Doctor Zoo seen before ... including Cowboy Dan's own step-daughter.

WHATEVER YOU DO, LUCAS PARKS, DON'T LET THE BAUD INFECTION SPREAD!

Lucas is under so much pressure to learn the skills needed to stop the Baud infection coursing through his system that he fails to notice just how dark and twisted his inner life has become. And once the Baud has him in their grip, they'll do anything to use Lucas as their pawn in a mission to destroy Doctor Zoo before his world-alerting Time Machine has a chance to exist.

Lucas Parks and the Download of Doom is Anthony Metivier's most riveting story to date, a searing, sensational, and thrilling ride with the most intense and spellbinding characters Metivier has ever brought to the page. Lucas Parks and the Download of Doom is Book One of The Baud Chronicles.

Memory Palace
Mnemonics
Cyberpunk

title: Free Memory Training Guide
description:
http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/free-memory-improvement-kit/

If you've ever wanted to double, triple or quadruple your memory abilities, then this may be one of the most important books you will ever read. 

In Warren Hilton's The Trained Memory (with an introduction and commentary by Anthony Metivier), you'll learn:

* How to improve your memory using famous icons like the Mona Lisa so that you can easily create powerful mental imagery that will allow you to recall information with ease.

* The secrets of using four memory processes that will literally "unlock" your memory abilities.

* How to "tune in" on your memory capacities by cultivating a state of awareness in the present. 

* The importance of "integral recall" and how to use it so that you can overcome the deficits of "ordinary thinking." 

* The basic principles of "thought reproduction" and how they can be used simplify complex groupings of information and ideas. 

* The art of compelling yourself to recall information, even when you don't feel up to it. 

* How to form the correct habits of memory and mnemonics so that you can memorize and recall information systematically and persistently. 

* How to use memory "tokens" to dramatically increase your recall. 

* The exact steps to take to improve your attention in order to improve sensory experience and imbue the mind with lightning quickness. 

* Daily morning routines and drills for increasing your mental capacity for observation, inventive thinking and positivity.

* ... and much, much more. 

Look, none of these techniques require brain surgery, crazy math or rocket science. These are simple strategies that real people have used to achieve massive improvements in their memory abilities simply by learning a few quick tricks, implementing them and changing how they think about the muscle between their ears.

But there's really no time to lose. Every day that you're not using the natural abilities of your mind by having a dedicated memorization strategy, you are missing out on walking through an open the door that will make literally anything possible.

Memory training
Mnemonics

title: David Mansaray On Passion, Polyglots and Postivity
description:
http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/david-mansaray-on-passion-polyglots-and-postivity/

In this episode of the Magnetic Memory Method Podcast, renowned polyglot and language learning expert David Mansaray talks about how to make sure that you're smarter tomorrow than you are today by using positivity, writing, observation and many more simple ideas you can start applying to your life immediately.

Listen to this episode of the Magnetic Memory Method Podcast right now to learn:

* The difference between self-education and self-directed learning and how to be proactive about your own education so that you can grow in the direction you want without hassle.

* The best way to use writing to refine your language skills so that you can experience boosts in fluency faster and with greater ease.

* Why you should avoid word frequency lists when learning a foreign language and what to do instead to build a massive (but targeted) vocabulary.

* How to learn to communicate at a deeper, conceptual level in your target language (as well as in your own mother tongue!)

* The real secrets to becoming a "hyper-polyglot."

* Why observation is just as important as taking instructions when learning from other people.

* Exactly what a mentor is and why you need one to help you clarify your thinking and decisions so that you can live an informed and positive life.

* How to deal with negativity and fear so that you can pursue your goals with an open mind and daring spirit.

* The importance of emotions and excitement in learning and how to generate them immediately.

* David's thoughts on the uses of Memory Palaces, Moonwalking with Einstein and other memory techniques, including a unique way to use streets as Memory Palaces when learning a new language.

* ... and much, much more.

title: Car Crash Survivor Michael Gusman Talks About Mnemonics And Brain Trauma
description:
http://www.magneticmemorymethod.com/free-memory-improvement-kit/

In this episode of the Magnetic Memory Method Podcast, you'll hear from Michael Gusman, a memory enthusiast who was t-boned by an SUV at 55 miles per hour. He suffered multiple injuries and a brain hemorrhage that left him with short term memory loss.

In this interview you'll learn Michael's personalized Memory Palace methods and how to get started on building your own.

You'll learn what the journey method is and how it can help you recall information without any effort.

You'll learn how having a dedicated memory strategy helped him deal with the fear and confusion of memory loss following his accident.

You'll hear about exactly how much of his recovery he attributes to the use of memory techniques.

You'll learn how to directly place information into your long term memory so that when you want to recall it, it's just like turning on a faucet.

You'll learn about number rhymes and wax tablets, key techniques that anyone can get started using right away.

You'll learn why memory techniques are a lot easier than they seem and how to use exotic action, images and even smells to help you memorize information.

You'll learn Michael's biggest mistakes as he was first learning memory techniques and building Memory Palaces so that you don't have to make them yourself.

... and much, much more.

Enjoy this interview and let both Michael and I know if you have any questions.

Anthony Metivier is the founder of the Magnetic Memory Method, a systematic, 21st Century approach to memorizing foreign language vocabulary in a way that is easy, elegant, effective and fun.

But there's really no time to lose.

Praise for the Magnetic Memory Method

"This concept is fascinating and much more fun that just learning a rote method. I am using this method and sticking with it in other areas of learning as well. Recommend this book for those who want to learn Russian or any language!"
- DJD

"I've used different mnemonic devices before, and I like how this one adds a new layer. It takes a good amount of work up front, but helps in the long run."
- Luke Creighton 

"Metivier actually explains, meticulously, just how to go about building memory palaces and filling them up with the French words (or words of any language that uses the Roman alphabet) you want to remember. He tells you what preparation steps are necessary, gives examples of the kind of vivid imagery you're going to use, and even suggests a schedule in which you devote one day a month to each of the 26 letters of the alphabet. I'm 58 years old, learning French with an aim to be reasonably fluent in a year: thanks to this technique, I feel confident I can do it. I'm memorizing around 100 words a day now, and it's fun, too!"
- Fiona

"I have read and put into practice the ideas in this book. The ideas presented are not your normal for memorizing vocabulary. that is why the book is good. It presents several DIFFERENT ideas to you that are possible for everyone , if given the time and effort. don't dismiss this book. If you have struggled with memorizing vocabulary in the past this book will give you several suggestions that will help you tremendously."
- S. Moore

"I have built the 26 memory palaces over the past week with 40 -- 50 locations per site. I've worked through your book and find it amazing that I can memorise a pack of cards and recite them back....I am struggling to believe this. I was I a meeting today with 20 people I have never met before, and I used the first 20 stations of the memory palace I built for the card memory exercise to remember names. I have always struggled with names before but I managed today to get this right. It felt good.

So far this process has been both successful for me and a huge amount of fun. I just thought I would write a short note, therefore, to thank you."

- Stephen Bell
